annotation: to arrange things, to put 			things in order
"I think (about something), lit. to arrange my neck".
vɛhei (it seems...): Pa Elias a ɛ-mata vɛhei… 'Elias thinks...'; alɔna ɛmata vɛhei... 'I think...'
Correction: Peter Just - loan from Malay/Arabic "fikir"

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect

annotation: Think, be of the opinion that (Bgs)

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: 1. To think (in the sense of having a thought enter one's mind)
2. To believe; to firmly think; to realise
3. To reckon; to think (w.r.t one's opinion about a matter)
4. To intend; to think; regard or consider; to bear in mind
5. To think; to come up with ideas for something
Think, consider, remember, wonder, try to understand; the mind, opinion (McE)

(a)POc *ronrom (Blust 1993) (b)PROc nan(o,u)mi- ; Given the range of witnesses supporting (a), we can infer that the forms in set (b) reflect an irregular change *nd > n that occurred, perhaps more than once, in certain Vanuatu languages and in Central Pa
Thought, memory, recollection, come to mind
looks like this form is entered wrong.
Think, call to mind, remember, thought (Fth)
Think of, call to mind, remember (Cwd)
Remember, recall, bear in mind, consider (Stn)
Think, have an idea, have an opinion (Rby)
for thought of it/by reason of it/because of it
for thought of it/by reason of it/because of it
